metadata.source: Secure Code KnAIght (SCK) - expanded SCW catalog mapping (authoritative mapping)
metadata.notes: Competencies intentionally exhaustive and normalized; roles reference competency ids.

competencies.label: Secure Coding Fundamentals
competencies.description: Core secure coding patterns, secure-by-default development, input/output handling, defensive programming.

trustLevels.L1: Understands common secure coding pitfalls and OWASP top 10 at high level.
trustLevels.L2: Can write code following secure patterns and basic sanitation.
trustLevels.L3: Designs and enforces secure coding practices across modules.
trustLevels.L4: Leads secure coding reviews and integrates secure frameworks.
trustLevels.L5: Defines org-wide secure coding standards and training.

competencies.label: Authentication & Session Management
competencies.description: Secure authentication flows, session handling, token lifecycle, brute-force protection, MFA.

trustLevels.L1: Recognizes weak authentication and session problems.
trustLevels.L2: Implements secure login, session expiration, and basic MFA.
trustLevels.L3: Designs robust auth solutions (SSO, OAuth2/OIDC) and session protections.
trustLevels.L4: Audits auth systems org-wide and approves designs.
trustLevels.L5: Defines enterprise identity standards and governance.

competencies.label: Access Control & Authorization
competencies.description: Role-based and attribute-based access control, preventing IDOR and BOLA, function-level authorization.

trustLevels.L1: Understands RBAC/ABAC basics and IDOR concepts.
trustLevels.L2: Can implement function-level authorization and RBAC policies.
trustLevels.L3: Designs and reviews fine-grained access controls across systems.
trustLevels.L4: Performs comprehensive access control audits and threat models.
trustLevels.L5: Sets enterprise authorization strategy and governance.

competencies.label: Injection Prevention (SQL/NoSQL/OS/Deserialization)
competencies.description: Prevent SQLi, NoSQLi, OS command, XML/XXE and unsafe deserialization vulnerabilities.

trustLevels.L1: Identifies injection patterns and understands escapes.
trustLevels.L2: Writes parameterized queries and validation for common injection vectors.
trustLevels.L3: Designs systems and libraries that mitigate injection at scale.
trustLevels.L4: Runs and validates org-wide protections against injection.
trustLevels.L5: Defines policy and code standards to prevent injection classes.

competencies.label: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) & CSRF
competencies.description: DOM, reflected, stored XSS remediation and CSRF protections (tokens, SameSite, CORS controls).

trustLevels.L2: Implements context-aware output encoding and CSRF tokens.
trustLevels.L3: Designs frameworks and templates that are XSS/CSRF-resistant.
trustLevels.L4: Audits frontends and APIs for these classes.
trustLevels.L5: Defines secure UI controls policy and training.

competencies.label: API Security & Gateway Controls
competencies.description: Secure API design, rate limiting, schema validation, API gateway, authorization for APIs and microservices.

trustLevels.L2: Implements input validation, rate limiting, and proper HTTP status handling.
trustLevels.L3: Designs secure microservice-to-microservice authentication and API gating.
trustLevels.L4: Defines org API security posture and gateway rules.
trustLevels.L5: Sets enterprise API governance and cross-team standards.

competencies.label: Cryptography & Key Management
competencies.description: Proper use of crypto libraries, key rotation, storage, algorithm selection, KMS integration.

trustLevels.L1: Understands symmetric vs asymmetric and basic crypto misuse.
trustLevels.L2: Implements crypto best-practices using libraries and KMS.
trustLevels.L3: Designs secure key lifecycle and rotation patterns.
trustLevels.L4: Audits crypto usage and approves enterprise-wide controls.
trustLevels.L5: Defines cryptographic governance and enterprise policies.

competencies.label: Secure Architecture & Threat Modeling
competencies.description: Threat modeling, secure design patterns, defense-in-depth, architectural review.

trustLevels.L1: Can read and understand threat models basics.
trustLevels.L2: Participates in threat modeling sessions.
trustLevels.L3: Leads threat models and architecture hardening.
trustLevels.L4: Approves cross-system architecture for security.
trustLevels.L5: Defines org-level architecture governance & patterns.

competencies.label: Cloud & DevOps Security

trustLevels.L3: Designs secure pipelines and hardened cloud deployments.

competencies.label: Secrets & Credentials Management
